p.s: The Indian Waters Trailer Park is the place where Pearl grew up.
It is place in northern Florida far away from the civilisationcivilization.
Close to the park is a dump that pollutes air and water.
As a result the air and water get poisonous and the people get sick.
Pearl descibes this as we breathed in the garbage.
Especially for kids the unhealthy environment can be very dangerous.
They are still growing and the poison could make them sick.
Furthermore the schools and working places are far away and not reachable.
They also got not working infrastructure there.
It is an aspect of humanity to offer them the possibility of better living conditions.
For example they could move them into manufactured houses or give the children into foster homes.
That would give them the chance to get educated and to get a good job.
They could achievachieve the American Dream and get from poor to rich.
For this they only need good education which can be provided by the government when they move into foster homes.
They also get financial help and health care.
But the most important thing is that Pearl would be safe and can live in a safe and healthy enviormentenvironment.
As we saw living in a car is not safe.
Because of the missing safety of living in a car her mother Margot got shot.
On the other hand Pearl likes the community in the trailer park and wants to stay by her mom.
She has friends there and gets treated very well.
In a foster home can be abusive or bad people who let you live on circumstances that are worse than in the trailer park.
Helen for example lived in 17 foster families and was treated very bad.
She is now traumatized and is not normal compared to kids in her age.
This also can be a point against the foster homes.
But if she wants to achieve something in life she must get out of the trailer park and enjoy a better education for a better future.
Compared with the American Dream she can get from poor to rich but everybody knows that this is not possible anymore.
In todaystoday's society, especially in America the gap between the rich and the poor is increasing in number.
The possibility to have a good future is today only reachable when you live in a wealthy or good educated family.
But is it necessary to get traumatic like Helen to achieve this?
Is there no other way?
Another solution could be to move the families of the trailer park into a manufactured house neighbourhood.
There they have schools and jobs in range and can get educated well.
Furthermore they can stay together with her family.
This is the most important aspect here.
Who wants to get taken away from his family?
Exactly nobody.
It is the most terriblest thing you can do to a child.
To put it all in a nutshell getting education to achieve the American Dream is a good aspect but not good enough to take a child away from her mother.
